title: Polar Satin White Radiator Spray Paint - 2 x 400ml | Heat Resistant up to 100ºC | Quick Drying & No Primer needed | Exterior Surfaces of Radiators & Hot Water Tanks | Heat Resistant Radiator Paint
features: Heat Resistant Spray Paint: Revive your radiators and other metal surfaces with Polar white Radiator Spray paint. Specially formulated to provide heat-resistant protection, it is suitable not only for radiators but also for high-temperature surfaces such as chimneys, fireplaces, and boilers. It protects against rust and color fade, withstanding temperatures up to 100°C. Perfect for high-performance results.

No Primer Needed: Polar radiator spray paint white works as a primer, undercoat, and topcoat, ensuring that your radiators and other metal surfaces remain durable, water-resistant, UV-protected, and looking fresh, preventing the need for repairs. Achieve professional-quality finishes with minimal effort and time. Cut costs and effort on additional products.

For Multi-Surface Use: Our white spray paint for radiator can be used on a wide variety of indoor metal surfaces, including heating pipes and water tanks. Its excellent adhesion ensures durability and resistance to cracking, fading and peeling on each application. It provides a smooth, even finish, significantly enhancing the appearance of your heating elements.

Easy to Use & DIY-Friendly: Our high-quality radiator primer is the choice for most DIY enthusiasts for its ease of use. Simply ensure the surface is free of dust, flakes, and residue by abrading the surface. Wipe with white spirit and a damp cloth to prepare for painting. Enjoy a smooth application and excellent coverage with Polar Radiator Spray paint.

Attractive Finish: Available in three colours – White, Black, and Anthracite – with Gloss, Satin, and Matt finishes. One 400ml can covers 2m². Shake the can thoroughly for at least two minutes and apply sparingly from a distance of 15-25 cm. Apply 2 to 3 light, even coats for total and even coverage.

Previous page Next page 1 Step One 2 Step Two 3 Step Three 4 Support Previous page Next page What surfaces is Polar Radiator Spray Paint suitable for? Polar Radiator Spray Paint can be used on radiators, heating pipes, water tanks, towel rails, chimneys, fireplaces, and boilers. Is there a maximum temperature limit for using this spray paint? Yes, it is not recommended for use on surfaces that are expected to exceed temperatures of 100°C. How many coats of Polar Radiator Spray Paint should be applied, and what is the drying time? For optimal results, apply 2-3 coats of Polar Radiator Spray Paint to ensure complete and even coverage. Drying times can vary based on environmental conditions. Is a primer required before applying the spray paint? No additional primer is necessary. This spray paint functions as both a primer and topcoat, providing excellent adhesion and a high-quality finish. Is Polar Radiator Spray Paint resistant to UV radiation and fading? Yes, Polar Radiator Spray Paint is formulated to be UV-resistant and is designed to endure prolonged exposure to sunlight without significant fading or degradation.
